document_data.mainbody:
enance Day was a religious festival observed by the lamas and monks of the Way of Enlightenment in Tabot.
On the eve of Penance Day, participants were temporarily released from all their vows and engaged freely in various indiscretions. For example, the lamas of Dodzin Gompa typically drank their potent mujahroom alcohol. The penance, presumably, was what came the morning after.
